title: Tiny RSA
description:
An RSA key was generated with very small primes:

p = 61
q = 53
e = 17
ciphertext (c) = 2790

Compute:
1. n = p × q
2. φ(n) = (p-1)(q-1)
3. d = modular inverse of e mod φ(n)
4. plaintext m = c^d mod n

The plaintext number corresponds to an ASCII character sequence. Submit it as: flag{plaintext_number}
hints: Find d where (17 × d) mod 3120 = 1 → d = 2753
